title: Our website font
content:
We do not have the original Photoshop files from when our website was designed several years ago. I'm hoping somebody can help us identify the font. It looks familiar to me, like a default font that would have installed on a Mac or PC in the past, but I cannot find it.

Thanks in advance for any help.  
Ken

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414234135im_/http:/typophile.com/files/wls-website-font_4069.jpg)
author: kstatham-wls

comments.content:
Very small samples, so difficult to ID definitively.

Peignot Demi, perhaps?:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/peignot/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414234135/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/peignot/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/peignot/")

Might also be Inegale:  
 [http://www.psyops.com/shop/inegale/inegale-set/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414234135/http:/www.psyops.com/shop/inegale/inegale-set/ "http://www.psyops.com/shop/inegale/inegale-set/")
Thanks so much. I agree it definitely looks like Inegale.

The asymmetrical |W| on your sample is a better match to Peignot.

Though I’m not seeing a gap between the stem and bowl of the |R| on your sample, as in Peignot, that may just be a function of the type size and anti-aliasing.

Hmm, I think you're right. I'm going to go with that, and adjust the letter height, spacing and faux bold in Photoshop to match what we currently have.

Thanks again! So glad to have found this site.

Ken
